oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.patterns.ui.behaviors.searchSuggest
Interface SearchSuggestGroup

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSearchSuggestGroup, DefaultGroupSuggestGroup, FavoriteItemsSearchSuggestGroup, GlobalLastSearchSuggestGroup, GlobalRecentSearchSuggestGroup, GlobalSavedSearchSuggestGroup, KeywordSearchSuggestGroup, KffAliasBean.AliasSearchSuggestGroup, NavigatorMenuSearchSuggestGroup, RecentItemsSearchSuggestGroup, WatchlistSearchSuggestGroup
public interface SearchSuggestGroup
extends java.io.Serializable

A Grouping of Search Suggest items as shown in the Global Search field in Fusion Apps. Implementors of this class should do so by extending AbstractSearchSuggestGroup so they can get any additional functionality as it is added.

Since:
11.1.1.7.2
See Also:
AbstractSearchSuggestGroup

Method Detail

init

void init(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> attributes)
Initialize the group, load any data as needed.

Note that this method may be run in a separate thread that has no Servlet/JSP/JSF/binding environment present, so do not rely on these. It is also quite possible, even likely (esp if init takes a while), that getItems(String, int) may be called before init() is done, so make sure getItems(String, int) can shortcut out efficiently (returning an empty list is the required functionality in this case).

Parameters:
attributes - the attributes from fnd:searchSuggestBehavior.
See Also:
canBackgroundInit(java.util.Map), getItems(java.lang.String, int)

canBackgroundInit

boolean canBackgroundInit(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> attributes)
Can init be run in the background? In some cases it can , which will save significant time on startup. In other cases it cannot as the init process requires access to the faces environment.

Parameters:
attributes - the attributes from fnd:searchSuggestBehavior.
Returns:
true if init() can run in a background thread, false otherwise.
See Also:
init(java.util.Map)

getDisplayName

java.lang.String getDisplayName()
Get the display name for the group. This will be shown in the autosuggest area as a sub-header.

Returns:
display name.

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Get the code name for the group. Non-translatable and should be short and unique across groups. It should conform to regular java variable identifiers (no exotic characters) so it can be serialized across the network.

Returns:
code name.

getIconURL

java.lang.String getIconURL()
Get the icon to be shown against this group.

Returns:
icon as a string, this will be a relative URL to the webapp, and needs to be common across all applications.

requiresSubmit

boolean requiresSubmit()
Does the auto suggest item require submit to the server, or should it simply be placed in the search field. If it requires submit, the developer needs to implement processSubmit(item) to handle the suggest item selection.

Returns:
true if the user-selection of the value should force a server submit, false if the value should just fill the search field.
See Also:
processSubmit(java.lang.String, java.util.Map)

processSubmit

void processSubmit(java.lang.String item,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> attributes)
Process a submit cause by the user selecting an auto suggest item in a group with requiresSubmit() == true.

Parameters:
item - the item seleced. Will be one of the items returned from getItems().
attributes - a Map of name value pairs sent from the client to provide some context from the environment when the item was selected. The defined values are
  1. n : name of this group,
  2. v : value - the same as the item parameter,
  3. width : width of the browser window,
  4. height : height of the browser window.
See Also:
requiresSubmit()

getItems

java.util.List<SearchSuggestItem> getItems(java.lang.String searchText,
                                           int maxSuggestedItems)
Get the list of items, in the order shown in the auto suggest group. There should be no HTML markup in the individual items, bolding etc will be done by the framework. This list should be relatively concise, and may be trimmed by the framework if it is too long.

Note that there should be no assumption made that init() has been run to completion (it may be running in a background thread when this method is called, dependent on the return value of canBackgroundInit()), an empty list should be returned if no data is present.

This method is called inline with user key-presses, it MUST run quickly (< 10 msecs) and will be timed by the framework.

Parameters:
searchText - the text currently in the search field. The developer should filter on this value to provide a concise list of suggest items.
maxSuggestedItems - maximum number of suggested items to return. More can be returned but they will not be used whoever it is strongly recommended no more than this number is returned, and implementations use this number to exit the method at the first opportunity for efficienct.
Returns:
List of items so show, possibly empty but never null.

getTopSuggestions

java.util.List<SearchSuggestItem> getTopSuggestions(java.lang.String searchText,
                                                    int maxSuggestedItems)
Get the list of top selection items.

These items are shown to the user in the search field when the user first clicks in the field, and are only shown for fnd:searchSelectBehaviors of type='popup' and topSuggestions='on'.

It is likely these items will not reflect any relation to 'searchText' which may be null, but show a simple starting list. Once the user starts to type, normal rules of getItems() will apply.

There should be no HTML markup in the individual items, bolding etc will be done by the framework. Note that there should be no assumption made that init() has been run to completion (it may be running in a background thread when this method is called, dependent on the return value of canBackgroundInit()), an empty list should be returned if no data is present.

This method is called when the user first enters the field, it MUST run quickly (< 10 msecs) and will be timed by the framework.

Parameters:
searchText - text in the search field, may be null and may be ignored.
maxSuggestedItems - maximum number of suggested items to return. More can be returned but they will not be used whoever it is strongly recommended no more than this number is returned, and implementations use this number to exit the method at the first opportunity for efficienct.
Returns:
List of items so show, possibly empty but never null.

itemSearched

void itemSearched(java.lang.String item,
                  long resultCount)
An item has been searched by the user. Process this item as appropriate. For example, the search term may be stored in the database as a previously searched item. In many cases this method will be a no-op.

Parameters:
item - keywords searched by user.
resultCount - the number of results.

setContextCode

void setContextCode(java.lang.String contextCode)
Set the context code for this group. This method will typically be called from the Search Suggest Behavior tag as it reads and sets attributes from the jsf xml document text.

Parameters:
contextCode - context code value.

getContextCode

java.lang.String getContextCode()
Get the context code for this group. Possibly null.

Returns:
context code for this group.

setObjectType

void setObjectType(java.lang.String objectType)
Set the object type for this group. This method will typically be called from the Search Suggest Behavior tag as it reads and sets attributes from the jsf xml document text. The Object type is only relevant if a context code is also set (it is a sub-classification).

Parameters:
objectType - the object type for the given object code.

getObjectType

java.lang.String getObjectType()
Get the object type within matched context code items that these items should match. It has meaning to the developer that defined it, and is expected to correspond to to a table/Object/Concept such as "Opportunity".

Returns:
object type to be used for filtering recent items, return null for all items within the context code.

setGroupIndex

void setGroupIndex(int index)
Set the group index of this group. This method will typically be called from the Search Suggest Behavior tag as it reads and sets attributes from the jsf xml document text and adds the group.

Parameters:
index - a number between 0 and the maximum number of groups defined, minus 1.

getGroupIndex

int getGroupIndex()
Get the index this group instance is within the list of groups.

Returns:
a number between 0 and the maximum number of groups defined, minus 1.
